abstract: The number was considerably down from the Biden-Palin debate in 2008 but larger than any other since 1984.
snippet: The number was considerably down from the Biden-Palin debate in 2008 but larger than any other since 1984.
lead_paragraph: Thursday’s televised debate between Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan attracted well over 50 million people — a significant chunk of the public, but a smaller total than the debate between the presidential candidates last week.

headline.main: Vice-Presidential Debate Draws More Than 50 Million Viewers
